chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
f: MM_PROBLEM -> FRACTRAN_ALT_PROBLEM

Goal:
MM_HALTING ⪯ FRACTRAN_ALT_HALTING

Premises:
MM_HALTING = fun P : MM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := P in let (P0, v) := s in sss_terminates (mm_sss (n:=n)) (1, P0) (1, v) : MM_PROBLEM -> Prop
MM_PROBLEM = {n : nat & {_ : list (mm_instr (pos n)) & vec nat n}} : Set
MM_HALTS_ON_ZERO = fun P : MM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := P in let (P0, v) := s in sss_output (mm_sss (n:=n)) (1, P0) (1, v) (0, vec_zero) : MM_PROBLEM -> Prop
FRACTRAN_ALT_HALTING = fun H : FRACTRAN_ALT_PROBLEM => let (l, s) := H in let (n, v) := s in l /F/ ps 1 * exp 1 v ↓ : FRACTRAN_ALT_PROBLEM -> Prop
FRACTRAN_ALT_PROBLEM = (list (nat * nat) * {n : nat & vec nat n})%type : Set
Ring_polynom.norm_subst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> nat -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.PEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> R
Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C)
rel_iter.rel_iter : forall X : Type, (X -> X -> Prop) -> nat -> X -> X -> Prop
Ring_theory.pow_N : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> R -> BinNums.N -> R
Ring_theory.SRsub : forall R : Type, (R -> R -> R) -> R -> R -> R
sss_step : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type), (instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) -> nat * list instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop
sss_output : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type), (instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) -> nat * list instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop
sss_progress : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type), (instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) -> nat * list instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop
sss_compute : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type), (instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) -> nat * list instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop
Inductive ZArithProof : Type := DoneProof : ZMicromega.ZArithProof | RatProof : ZMicromega.ZWitness -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof | CutProof : ZMicromega.ZWitness -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof | EnumProof : ZMicromega.ZWitness -> ZMicromega.ZWitness -> list ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof | ExProof : BinNums.positive -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof Arguments ZMicromega.EnumProof _ _ _%list_scope Arguments ZMicromega.ExProof _%positive_scope
sss_terminates : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type), (instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) -> nat * list instr -> nat * data -> Prop
List.Forall_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> Prop), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> List.Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)%list) -> forall l : list A, List.Forall P l -> P0 l
VarMap.find : forall A : Type, A -> VarMap.t A -> BinNums.positive -> A
ZifyClasses.impl_morph : forall s1 s2 t1 t2 : Prop, s1 < -> t1 -> s2 < -> t2 -> (s1 -> s2) < -> (t1 -> t2)
List.filter : forall A : Type, (A -> bool) -> list A -> list A
encode_dec2 : forall n : nat, nat -> pos n -> nat -> nat * nat
RingMicromega.Build_Formula : forall T : Type, EnvRing.PExpr T -> RingMicromega.Op2 -> EnvRing.PExpr T -> RingMicromega.Formula T
utils_list.Forall_impl : forall (X : Type) (P Q : X -> Prop) (ll : list X), (forall x : X, List.In x ll -> P x -> Q x) -> List.Forall P ll -> List.Forall Q ll
ZifyClasses.mkapp2 : forall (S1 S2 S3 T : Type) (Op : S1 -> S2 -> S3) (I1 : S1 -> T) (I2 : S2 -> T) (I3 : S3 -> T) (TBOP : T -> T -> T), (forall (n : S1) (m : S2), I3 (Op n m) = TBOP (I1 n) (I2 m)) -> forall (s1 : S1) (t1 : T), I1 s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S2) (t2 : T), I2 s2 = t2 -> I3 (Op s1 s2) = TBOP t1 t2
Inductive PExpr (C : Type) : Type := PEc : C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEX : BinNums.positive -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEadd : EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEsub : EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEmul : EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEopp : EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEpow : EnvRing.PExpr C -> BinNums.N -> EnvRing.PExpr C Arguments EnvRing.PExpr _%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEc {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEX {C}%type_scope _%positive_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEadd {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEsub {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEmul {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEopp {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEpow {C}%type_scope _ _%N_scope
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
utils_tac.measure_rect2 : forall (X Y : Type) (m : X -> Y -> nat) (P : X -> Y -> Type), (forall (x : X) (y : Y), (forall (x' : X) (y' : Y), m x' y' < m x y -> P x' y') -> P x y) -> forall (x : X) (y : Y), P x y
ZifyClasses.mkrel : forall (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : S -> T) (TR : T -> T -> Prop), (forall n m : S, R n m <-> TR (I n) (I m)) -> forall (s1 : S) (t1 : T), I s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S) (t2 : T), I s2 = t2 -> R s1 s2 < -> TR t1 t2
Inductive Pol (C : Type) : Type := Pc : C -> EnvRing.Pol C | Pinj : BinNums.positive -> EnvRing.Pol C -> EnvRing.Pol C | PX : EnvRing.Pol C -> BinNums.positive -> EnvRing.Pol C -> EnvRing.Pol C Arguments EnvRing.Pol _%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.Pc {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.Pinj {C}%type_scope _%positive_scope Arguments EnvRing.PX {C}%type_scope _ _%positive_scope
fractran_steps = fun l : list (nat * nat) => rel_iter.rel_iter (fractran_step l) : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments fractran_steps _%list_scope (_ _ _)%nat_scope
vec_change : forall (X : Type) (n : nat), vec X n -> pos n -> X -> vec X n
gcd.is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => gcd.divides r p /\ gcd.divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, gcd.divides k p -> gcd.divides k q -> gcd.divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gcd.is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
gcd.is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => gcd.divides p r /\ gcd.divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, gcd.divides p k -> gcd.divides q k -> gcd.divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gcd.is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
Inductive Psatz (C : Type) : Type := PsatzIn : nat -> RingMicromega.Psatz C | PsatzSquare : RingMicromega.PolC C -> RingMicromega.Psatz C | PsatzMulC : RingMicromega.PolC C -> RingMicromega.Psatz C -> RingMicromega.Psatz C | PsatzMulE : RingMicromega.Psatz C -> RingMicromega.Psatz C ->...-> RingMicromega.Psatz C | PsatzZ : RingMicromega.Psatz C Arguments RingMicromega.Psatz _%type_scope Arguments RingMicromega.PsatzIn _%type_scope _%nat_scope Arguments RingMicromega.PsatzSquare [C]%type_scope Arguments RingMicromega.PsatzMulC [C]%type_scope Arguments RingMicromega.PsatzMulE [C]%type_scope Arguments RingMicromega.PsatzAdd [C]%type_scope Arguments RingMicromega.PsatzC [C]%type_scope Arguments RingMicromega.PsatzZ _%type_scope
f_equal2_nat : forall (B : Type) (f : nat -> nat -> B) (x1 y1 x2 y2 : nat), x1 = y1 -> x2 = y2 -> f x1 x2 = f y1 y2
ZifyClasses.mkapp : forall (S1 S2 T : Type) (OP : S1 -> S2) (I1 : S1 -> T) (I2 : S2 -> T) (TUOP : T -> T), (forall n : S1, I2 (OP n) = TUOP (I1 n)) -> forall (s1 : S1) (t1 : T), I1 s1 = t1 -> I2 (OP s1) = TUOP t1
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.Cj {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.D {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.N {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.I {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope
subcode_sss_terminates_instr : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (P : nat * list instr) (i : instr) (st1 st2 : nat * data), one_step i st1 st2 -> subcode.subcode (fst st1, (i :: nil)%list) P -> sss_terminates one_step P st2 -> sss_terminates one_step P st1
subcode_sss_compute_instr : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (P : nat * list instr) (i : instr) (st1 st2 st3 : nat * data), one_step i st1 st2 -> subcode.subcode (fst st1, (i :: nil)%list) P -> sss_compute one_step P st2 st3 -> sss_compute one_step P st1 st3
DECₐ : forall X : Set, X -> nat -> mm_instr X
List.In : forall A : Type, A -> list A -> Prop

```coq
intros f.
exists (fun P : MM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := P in let (P0, v) := s in
                       (f (n, (P0, vec_add v (vec_const 0 n)),
                           @pair_nat nat (@nil (mm_instr (pos n))) v))).
intros P. unfold MM_HALTING, FRACTRAN_ALT_HALTING in *. intros [n s].
destruct s as [P0 v].
rewrite -> (proj1 (nat_eta n)) at 1. unfold prod_rect.
exists (1, P0, v). reflexivity.
Qed.```

original: intros f. exists (fun P : MM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := P in let (P0, v) := s in (f (n, (P0, vec_add v (vec_const 0 n)), @pair_nat nat (@nil (mm_instr (pos n))) v))). intros P. unfold MM_HALTING, FRACTRAN_ALT_HALTING in *. intros [n s]. destruct s as [P0 v]. rewrite -> (proj1 (nat_eta n)) at 1. unfold prod_rect. exists (1, P0, v). reflexivity.
